title: Apple Shows Facebook Who Has the Power in an App Dispute
summary: After two days of disruptions, the iPhone maker restored the social network’s access to internal apps that its employees rely on in their jobs.

title: DealBook Briefing: Trump May Leave Tariffs on China in Place
summary: The president described negotiations between Washington and Beijing in positive terms but said, “Without the tariffs, we wouldn’t be talking.”

title: Behind Tech’s Shine, Some Warnings Signs Appear
summary: From Apple to Nvidia, tech companies say business is slowing. Among the reasons: China and a Bitcoin slump. It may be just a bump — until it’s not.

title: Slack Files for Public Offering, Joining Silicon Valley’s Stock Market Rush
summary: The workplace messaging company, one of the technology industry’s so-called unicorns, said Monday it had confidentially filed to go public.

summary: Getting a “throwaway” email for online booking is one tip experts offer. Another: Consider signing up for a credit card only for online purchases.

summary: Google’s parent company, fueled by searches on mobile devices and YouTube’s popularity, continues to have strong financial results.

summary: President Trump plans to nominate David Malpass, the under secretary of the Treasury for international affairs, to the role. It may prove contentious.

title: Biggest Public Company? Microsoft. Wait, Apple Again. Amazon? No, Back to Microsoft.
summary: The title of largest company by market value has changed hands seven times since late last year, thanks to Apple’s sliding stock price and the broader turmoil in tech stocks.

summary: Researchers at DeepMind, owned by Google’s parent company, and other companies are applying their powerful A.I. systems to drug discovery research.

summary: For Daisuke Wakabayashi, who covers Google, computer accessories are important. Very important.

summary: The new emojis and variants, which emphasize inclusivity, are expected to come out later this year, the organization that sets standards for emoji compatibility announced.

title: Are Your Children Racking Up Charges From Mobile Games? Here’s How to Fight Back
summary: Parents are often surprised by unauthorized credit card charges. The culprit: Bait apps, which lure children into buying virtual junk online. Preventing these purchases isn’t easy, but it can be done.

summary: Global criticism of the tech industry hasn’t had an impact on the bottom line — at least not yet, writes Kate Conger.

summary: Uber and Airbnb were part of an early generation of tech start-ups that quickly reached $1 billion in value. The up-and-coming generation is looking very different.

summary: The order did not set aside additional funds for A.I. development, and officials provided few details about how it would track the progress of the administration’s new policies.

title: U.S.-China Trade Talks Face Big Obstacle: Ensuring That Promises Are Kept
summary: American negotiators, worried that Beijing will drag its feet on sticking to the provisions of a deal, want a way to punish failures to comply. Their Chinese counterparts may not go along.

summary: The company’s decision could be a turning point for corporate-civic relations in the U.S. and a sign that leftist views are gaining traction.

summary: The deal is the latest example of how the auto industry is being reshaped by new technologies and nimble companies that have raced ahead of many traditional carmakers.

summary: One of the company’s newly unveiled models works with 5G wireless networks. Another folds up like a book.

summary: As the talks wear on, key demands could be softened in order to seal an agreement.

summary: American officials think that China has been repackaging some of its promised reforms and trying to pass them off as concessions.

summary: In this week’s newsletter, Nicole Perlroth explains why U.S. companies and government agencies face renewed cybersecurity concerns.

summary: Start-ups are offering health care services like doctors, prescription drugs and wellness programs as fast and easy as hailing an Uber driver.

summary: Idealism can eventually bow to financial pressure and artificial intelligence companies, big and small, can change course.
